question.title: QuickFIX/J javax.net.ssl.SSLException: Tag mismatch
question.body:
I'm running performance test with QuickFIX/J initiator and acceptor, both running in separate docker container. Initiator sends Market Data Request and acceptor streams Market Data - Snapshot/Full Refresh. Everything goes fine for 10 minutes or 1 hour, but randomly the following error occur:

FIX.4.4:initiator_123->acceptor_123: Disconnecting: Socket exception (dev-server/123.123.123.123:5252): javax.net.ssl.SSLException: Tag mismatch

What may cause such a problem? Previously I've started with following config EnabledProtocols=TLSv1.2,TLSv1.3, but removal of TLSv1.3 didn't solve the problem.

Acceptor config part:

SenderCompID=*
TargetCompID=*
SocketAcceptPort=5252
SocketNodelay=N
SocketReuseAddress=Y
PersistMessages=N
SocketUseSSL=Y
UseSNI=Y
EnabledProtocols=TLSv1.2
SocketKeyStore=../mock-server/test.jks
SocketKeyStorePassword=password


[SESSION]
AcceptorTemplate=Y

Initiator config part:

DefaultApplVerID=FIX.4.4
ConnectionType=initiator
SocketNodelay=N
SocketUseSSL=Y
UseSNI=Y
EnabledProtocols=TLSv1.2

Key is generated via docker command before app start:

RUN keytool -genkeypair -alias test -keyalg RSA -keystore test.jks -storepass password -keypass password -validity 365 -dname "CN=localhost" -ext "san=ip:127.0.0.1"

question_comments.body: There is an OpenJDK bug report with an identical error: bugs.openjdk.org/browse/JDK-8293973
Is there a stack trace after the error? If so please edit the question to add it.
I don't think this is a problem with QFJ.
